summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan scheduling a remote video/teleconference arraignment, initial conference, and bail hearing for Ghislaine Maxwell on July 14, 2020. It outlines COVID-19 protocols for courthouse entry, procedures for the defendant's waiver of right to be present, and exclusions of time under the Speedy Trial Act.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case for whom an arraignment, initial conference, and bail hearing is being scheduled.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge issuing the order scheduling the proceedings and outlining the protocols.

events.title: Remote Arraignment, Conference, and Bail Hearing
events.description: A remote video/teleconference arraignment, initial conference, and bail hearing scheduled for Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Court Order Issued
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan issues the order scheduling the remote proceedings and outlining protocols.

locations: Daniel Patrick Moynihan Courthouse, 500 Pearl Street, New York, NY
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's arraignment, initial conference, and bail hearing was scheduled for July 14, 2020, to be conducted remotely via video/teleconference due to COVID-19.
The order details strict COVID-19 entry protocols for the courthouse, including a health questionnaire, temperature checks, and mandatory face coverings.
Time under the Speedy Trial Act was excluded from the defendant's arrest through July 14, 2020, due to logistical issues with the remote proceeding and the need to discuss a protective order.
The government was instructed to inform the court if any alleged victim wished to be heard on the question of detention pending trial, in accordance with victims' rights statutes.
A public video feed of the remote proceeding was made available in the Jury Assembly Room at the Daniel Patrick Moynihan Courthouse, with extremely limited seating due to social distancing.
